intro: Rhopalocarpus louvelii, commonly known as the Madagascar starwood, is a small evergreen tree native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its dense, rounded crown and glossy dark green leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, followed by red, fleshy berries. It thrives in tropical climates and is often found in humid, shaded forest environments. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
